channel.title: Underwater cavern
channel.description:
Decided to create a world with the seed of some of my favorite numbers. Opening the debug screen, the seed changed (no big). Anyways, while exploring a bit I found a lake. However, there seemed to be some light coming from the middle of it. Taking a look, I noticed that the light I saw was actually the fog from a cavern under the lake.
Seed: 2114122064 Pos: 34, 384
Note: I'm not sure if the "Generate Structures" option matters, but I turned it off.
Also: The first time I created the world, the lake was already open. However, you may need to dig out some sand near the middle of the lake. It starts a chain reaction with the other sand blocks and the cave opens up.
The cave is quite expansive and unlike any other cave I've seen before. Instead of being rough, it is very tall and very long.
Pictures: [IMG]http://i1115.photobucket.com/albums/k557/Lord_Zymus/Minecraft/2011-10-09_230629.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1115.photobucket.com/albums/k557/Lord_Zymus/Minecraft/2011-10-09_230643.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1115.photobucket.com/albums/k557/Lord_Zymus/Minecraft/2011-10-09_230655.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1115.photobucket.com/albums/k557/Lord_Zymus/Minecraft/2011-10-09_230742.png[/img]

item.title: Underwater cavern
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:5, topic:417654”]Lol no light

It does look rather cool. I’ll check it out later.[/quote]

It’s because I only went inside once, then died. Not shown in the picture, but there are about 15 creepers at the bottom.

That’s pretty cool, but it’s a Ravine, not a cave
